alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Forsyth (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 8:51PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A slow moving cluster of thunderstorms producing heavy rain will impact portions of western Forsyth and northwestern Davidson Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 848 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms producing heavy rain along a line extending from near East Bend to 6 miles north of Spencer. Movement was north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain and gusty winds. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rain may lead to isolated flooding especially in poor drainage locations. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Winston-Salem, Clemmons, Bermuda Run, Lewisville, Donnaha and High Rock Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
